title: 78, I Repeat, 78 Gifts You Can Still Buy in Time for the Holidays
description: Everything you could possibly need is all right here.
excerpt: Shop our editor's curation of 78 products perfect for the holiday gifting season. Shop selects from Solawave, The North Face, & Other Stories, and more.
text: Word on the street is that the holidays are nearing faster than anticipated. The weeks between Thanksgiving and New Year's have always been a blur, but this year, something feels extra chaotic. The one area I can count on staying organized in is the gifting department. The best holiday presents run the gamut from classic sweaters, socks, and slippers to hyper-unique and personalized favorites—but I know I'm not alone in the struggle to find a gift for that one person it feels impossible to shop for (I'm sure a few come to mind for you, too).Luckily, there's no shortage of ideas here, whether you're shopping for a bestie, a co-worker, or your third cousin twice removed. In fact, there are 78 products from 13 of our go-to gifting brands, so there's no way you can scroll to the end of this story without finding at least one gift. Featuring everything from the viral Solawave red light therapy products to stylish outerwear from The North Face, my curated list of holiday gifts is ready for you to shop below.(Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)First on the list, we have Coach Outlet, an editor-favorite destination for scoring Coach's luxury goods at a fraction of the cost. The site boasts a wide variety of products from coveted tote bags to adorable bag charms. The items I've shared below will make great gifts for a variety of age ranges. For your mom, go for the Mollie Tote Bag. For your Gen Z cousin, opt for the Star Cluster Bag Charm. Coach Outlet Micro Wallet Coach Outlet Mollie Tote Bag Coach Outlet Oversized Muffler Coach Outlet Black Leather Tech Gloves Coach Outlet Star Cluster Bag Charm (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)I dare you to try not to shop for yourself in this section. & Other Stories is serving an impressive collection of winterwear trends that I'd like to buy for myself this holiday season. For trending accessories, leather riding boots and woven bags are what editors are shopping for. For classic apparel, you can never go wrong with a wool coat, blazer, or red cardigan. Anyone who appreciates high-quality clothing will want to unwrap these gifts. & Other Stories Leather Riding Boots & Other Stories Braided Leather Tote & Other Stories High-Waist Mini Skirt & Other Stories Wool Blazer & Other Stories Alpaca-Blend Knit Cardigan & Other Stories Single-Breasted Coat (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)When in doubt, always go for a gift from the beauty category. Who wouldn't want a new lip gloss or luxe hand cream? QVC is chock full of the best beauty products on the market. It carries viral products like the T3 Airebrush ($150) and industry favorites like the Peter Thomas Roth face mask sets. Whether you're looking for something big or small, check out the following six gift ideas. L'Occitane Shea Intensive Hand Balm Lawless Beauty Forget the Filler Lip Gloss Viktor & Rolf Flowerbomb Eau De Parfum Peter Thomas Roth 24K Gold Eye Patches and Mask Mason Pearson Detangler Hair Brush (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)Everyone could use a new coat for winter—it's a fact. It's our most worn apparel item for almost six months of the year—at least for those of us in colder climates—which means we get a lot of use out of it. My top recommendation for outerwear that's warm but still stylish is always The North Face. You may be wearing these jackets day in and day out, but you'll never grow tired of the look. To shop The North Face's range of parkas, hoodies, and vests, keep scrolling. The North Face Gore-Tex® Mountain Jacket The North Face Hydrenalite™ Down Hoodie The North Face Nuptse Short Jacket The North Face Hydrenalite™ Down Parka The North Face Aconcagua 3 Vest The North Face Aconcagua Parka (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)If you want to score major points with the fashion lover in your family or friend group, head straight to AG. This brand is a mainstay in the fashion sets' wardrobes for its high-quality denim and corduroy pieces. I stand firm in my belief that denim can be worn year-round, so any of the items below is guaranteed to be a well-used gift. For a more seasonal option, AG's corduroy pieces are a modern take on this classic material. AG Deven Ultra Wide Leg Jeans AG Deven AG-ed™ Ultra Wide Leg Denim (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)There is nothing more thrilling than unboxing a new pair of shoes. If I can't have a puppy, then I will happily settle for a new pair of booties. Vince Camuto has the trending styles to invest in this season. Moto boots, suede fabrics, and western silhouettes are the styles editors recommend, but anything oxblood or leopard print are great options, too. Vince Camuto Eloise Mary Jane Flat Vince Camuto Laila Bootie Vince Camuto Sibrina Pump Vince Camuto Payton Bootie (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)Because there is no such thing as too much denim (a rule I abide by), make sure you check out these options from Mavi this gifting season. Recently ranked #8 on Time's List of the World’s Best 500 Companies in Sustainable Growth, Mavi is a brand combining conscious manufacturing practices with stylish design. These pieces will make great gifts for your loved ones who appreciate good style and eco-friendly shopping habits. Mavi Kathleen Slim Boyfriend Mavi Sandra Cuffed Wide Leg (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)Let's talk bags for a minute. Whether it's a tote, a top handle bag, crescent-shaped, or made out of denim, there's not one option from Kurt Geiger I wouldn't want to receive. The brand's offerings range from bold statement pieces to timeless, everyday options. If you're looking for a luxe leather accessory that is under $500, I'd start with these. Kurt Geiger Large Denim Kensington Bag Kurt Geiger Large Chelsea Drench Tote Bag Kurt Geiger Mini Leather Kensington Bag Kurt Geiger XS Bond Top Handle Bag Kurt Geiger Kensington Card Charm Kurt Geiger Tartan Octavia Moonbag (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)If you prefer leaning into more classic gift options, Kenneth Cole is the destination for you. Think coats, watches, and boots—three staple categories we return to time and again during the holidays. These are certified crowd-pleasers; gifts that will actually be used, and dare I say, not exchanged. I, for one, wouldn't return any of the following six gifts, so keep scrolling to see which ones made the cut. Kenneth Cole Faux Leather Short Trench Kenneth Cole Meryl Suede Bootie Kenneth Cole Oversized V-Neck Sweater Kenneth Cole Faux Shearling Moto Jacket Kenneth Cole Transparency Gift Set Kenneth Cole The Classic Fit Overcoat (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)Another favorite brand in the world of accessories is Pair Eyewear. Its style offerings range from classic cat-eye shapes to colorful, on-trend frames. Best of all, you can customize your frame color, lens color, and add in a prescription if needed. There are even magnetic snap-on frames if you want to keep the shape, but switch out the color or pattern depending on your outfit. Below, you'll find my favorite silhouettes, but click the links to discover the ways you can personalize these glasses.(Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)If you want to gift a skincare tool that shows immediate results, start with Solawave. This is a brand I have personally tested, and I was amazed by how even my skin tone looked right after use. Red light therapy has been proven to help with signs of aging, reduce inflammation, and stimulate collagen production. The wand has done wonders for reducing my acne and depuffing my face, so I'm eager to get my hands on the rest of Solawave's products. Solawave Red Light Therapy Wand & Activating Serum Kit Solawave Neck & Chest Rejuvenating Mask Solawave Radiant Renewal Eye Recovery Pro Solawave Radiant Renewal 2-In-1 Skincare Mini Solawave Bye Acne: 3-Minute Pimple Spot Treatment Solawave Solabiome Glowing Skin Starter Kit (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)For the skincare enthusiasts in your life (or even that one family member who still doesn't use SPF), One Skin is an excellent choice. Novices and experts alike rave about this brand for its star ingredient: OS-01. It is the first ingredient scientifically proven to reverse your skin's biological age. The reviews are in and the results show improved elasticity, hydration, and firmness overall. One Skin Complete Longevity Regimen One Skin Prep Facial Cleanser One Skin OS-01 Topical Supplement One Skin Triple Power OS-01 Body SPF One Skin OS-01 Eye Topical Supplement One Skin OS-01 Face SPF 30+ Set (Image credit: Original Illustration by Yracema Rivas)It's not a holiday gift guide without a few tech gadgets, and this year, our top recommendations are from Sonos. Sonos is a leading audio technology company that has revolutionized how people listen and connect to sound. The brand has created wireless speakers, home theater systems, headphones, architectural components, and whole home audio solutions. There is no better time to give the gift of new headphones or portable speakers. Keep scrolling to shop Sonos's top offerings. Sonos Era 100 Smart Speaker Sonos Era 300 Premium Smart Speaker Sonos Roam 2 Ultra Smart Speaker Sonos Move 2 Smart Speaker Sonos Beam Smart Soundbar
html:
Word on the street is that the holidays are nearing faster than anticipated. The weeks between Thanksgiving and New Year's have always been a blur, but this year, something feels extra chaotic. The one area I can count on staying organized in is the gifting department. The best holiday presents run the gamut from classic sweaters, socks, and slippers to hyper-unique and personalized favorites—but I know I'm not alone in the struggle to find a gift for that one person it feels impossible to shop for (I'm sure a few come to mind for you, too).

Luckily, there's no shortage of ideas here, whether you're shopping for a bestie, a co-worker, or your third cousin twice removed. In fact, there are 78 products from 13 of our go-to gifting brands, so there's no way you can scroll to the end of this story without finding at least one gift. Featuring everything from the viral Solawave red light therapy products to stylish outerwear from The North Face, my curated list of holiday gifts is ready for you to shop below.

First on the list, we have Coach Outlet, an editor-favorite destination for scoring Coach's luxury goods at a fraction of the cost. The site boasts a wide variety of products from coveted tote bags to adorable bag charms. The items I've shared below will make great gifts for a variety of age ranges. For your mom, go for the Mollie Tote Bag. For your Gen Z cousin, opt for the Star Cluster Bag Charm.

I dare you to try not to shop for yourself in this section. & Other Stories is serving an impressive collection of winterwear trends that I'd like to buy for myself this holiday season. For trending accessories, leather riding boots and woven bags are what editors are shopping for. For classic apparel, you can never go wrong with a wool coat, blazer, or red cardigan. Anyone who appreciates high-quality clothing will want to unwrap these gifts.

When in doubt, always go for a gift from the beauty category. Who wouldn't want a new lip gloss or luxe hand cream? QVC is chock full of the best beauty products on the market. It carries viral products like the T3 Airebrush ($150) and industry favorites like the Peter Thomas Roth face mask sets. Whether you're looking for something big or small, check out the following six gift ideas.

Everyone could use a new coat for winter—it's a fact. It's our most worn apparel item for almost six months of the year—at least for those of us in colder climates—which means we get a lot of use out of it. My top recommendation for outerwear that's warm but still stylish is always The North Face. You may be wearing these jackets day in and day out, but you'll never grow tired of the look. To shop The North Face's range of parkas, hoodies, and vests, keep scrolling.

If you want to score major points with the fashion lover in your family or friend group, head straight to AG. This brand is a mainstay in the fashion sets' wardrobes for its high-quality denim and corduroy pieces. I stand firm in my belief that denim can be worn year-round, so any of the items below is guaranteed to be a well-used gift. For a more seasonal option, AG's corduroy pieces are a modern take on this classic material.

There is nothing more thrilling than unboxing a new pair of shoes. If I can't have a puppy, then I will happily settle for a new pair of booties. Vince Camuto has the trending styles to invest in this season. Moto boots, suede fabrics, and western silhouettes are the styles editors recommend, but anything oxblood or leopard print are great options, too.

Because there is no such thing as too much denim (a rule I abide by), make sure you check out these options from Mavi this gifting season. Recently ranked #8 on Time's List of the World’s Best 500 Companies in Sustainable Growth, Mavi is a brand combining conscious manufacturing practices with stylish design. Let's talk bags for a minute. Whether it's a tote, a top handle bag, crescent-shaped, or made out of denim, there's not one option from Kurt Geiger I wouldn't want to receive. The brand's offerings range from bold statement pieces to timeless, everyday options. If you're looking for a luxe leather accessory that is under $500, I'd start with these.

If you prefer leaning into more classic gift options, Kenneth Cole is the destination for you. Think coats, watches, and boots—three staple categories we return to time and again during the holidays. These are certified crowd-pleasers; gifts that will actually be used, and dare I say, not exchanged. Another favorite brand in the world of accessories is Pair Eyewear. Its style offerings range from classic cat-eye shapes to colorful, on-trend frames. Best of all, you can customize your frame color, lens color, and add in a prescription if needed. There are even magnetic snap-on frames if you want to keep the shape, but switch out the color or pattern depending on your outfit. Below, you'll find my favorite silhouettes, but click the links to discover the ways you can personalize these glasses.

If you want to gift a skincare tool that shows immediate results, start with Solawave. This is a brand I have personally tested, and I was amazed by how even my skin tone looked right after use. Red light therapy has been proven to help with signs of aging, reduce inflammation, and stimulate collagen production. The wand has done wonders for reducing my acne and depuffing my face, so I'm eager to get my hands on the rest of Solawave's products.

For the skincare enthusiasts in your life (or even that one family member who still doesn't use SPF), One Skin is an excellent choice. Novices and experts alike rave about this brand for its star ingredient: OS-01. It is the first ingredient scientifically proven to reverse your skin's biological age. The reviews are in and the results show improved elasticity, hydration, and firmness overall.

It's not a holiday gift guide without a few tech gadgets, and this year, our top recommendations are from Sonos. Sonos is a leading audio technology company that has revolutionized how people listen and connect to sound. The brand has created wireless speakers, home theater systems, headphones, architectural components, and whole home audio solutions.
